title: Inquiry-Based Science Instructional Design Theory Evaluation and Practice Course

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational understanding of secondary science curriculum design and learning theories, experience with scientific inquiry methods (hypothesis formulation–experimentation–analysis–conclusion)
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented training program for in-service secondary science teachers, conducted at a corporate training center. Focuses on developing applicable assessment tools and evidence-based improvement strategies for science lesson design.

learning_goals: Apply learning theories to assess the effectiveness of science education products based on experimental data and observational evidence.
Write learning theory-based evaluation reports through research and creative approaches, applying variable control and analytical methods.
Experience the process of improving assessment design by reflecting on peer feedback and strengthen the ability to derive conclusions following scientific inquiry procedures.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
